thread.title: Bills rally from 10-point deficit, beat Titans 14-13
thread.title_full: Bills rally from 10-point deficit, beat Titans 14-13

title: Bills rally from 10-point deficit, beat Titans 14-13
text:
Bills rally from 10-point deficit, beat Titans 14-13 - WSMV Channel 4 Member Center: Bills rally from 10-point deficit, beat Titans 14-13 Posted: 
By TERESA M. WALKERAP Pro Football Writer 
NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) - Tyrod Taylor threw a touchdown pass, ran for another and even caught a pass in rallying the Buffalo Bills to a 14-13 win over the Tennessee Titans on Sunday. 
With their top two running backs and top wide receiver out injured, Taylor ran for 77 yards as the Bills (3-2) snapped a five-game skid against Tennessee. 
Taylor ran for a 22-yard TD late in the third quarter after a 26-yard run that was Buffalo's biggest play of the game. Taylor also scrambled for 24 more on third-and-23 from the Bills 7 jumpstarting an 80-yard drive he capped with a 2-yard TD pass to Chris Hogan. Taylor caught a 4-yard pass from Hogan to set up that TD. 
Stephon Gilmore intercepted Marcus Mariota's pass with 1:32 left to seal the win. 
The Titans (1-3) blew a second straight double-digit lead at home.
